channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Epstein files mention Trump. And, SCOTUS rules on National Guard in Chicago
item.description: The DOJ released tens of thousands of new documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, the Supreme Court ruled that the National ...

item.title: Greetings from Jaffa, Israel, where a salon is a welcoming space for Palestinians and Jews
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: U.S. and Ukraine reach consensus on key issues aimed at ending the war
item.description: The United States and Ukraine have reached a consensus on several critical issues, but sensitive issues around territorial control in Ukraine's easter...

item.title: In the snow, these salamanders get supercool
item.description: Blue spotted salamanders have been seen walking across snow and new research suggests how they get by in the cold.

item.title: When porch pirates steal medicine instead of holiday gifts
item.description: Mail theft can happen around the holidays, but sometimes, instead of getting a new iPad, the thief swipes a mail order medicine. Here's what to do abo...

item.title: NORAD tracks Santa in Christmas tradition. See the live map.
item.description: NORAD, the North American Aerospace Defense Command, tracks Santa's Christmas Eve flight around the world each year. Follow a live map of the tracker ...

item.title: Democratic board member muted during Kennedy Center vote sues to remove Trump's name
item.description: US Representative Joyce Beatty claims the renaming of the venue is illegal because the change requires "an act of Congress".

item.title: Thieves use stolen SUV to rip ATM out of Texas store in destructive heist
item.description: Thieves hooked an ATM to a stolen SUV and ripped the machine out of a Texas convenience store in a brazen robbery captured on video released Wednesday...

item.title: Algerian law declares France's colonisation a crime
item.description: Lawmakers unanimously approve a law, which demands an apology and reparations from the former colonial power.

item.title: Officials discover a million more documents potentially related to Epstein case
item.description: The US Department of Justice says reviewing the material could delay release by a "few more weeks".

item.title: Hawaii cruise passengers face new climate change tax after court ruling
item.description: The new tourist tax imposes an 11% tax on the gross fares paid by a cruise ship's passengers to address climate change threats to Hawaii.

item.title: Two police officers killed in explosion in Moscow
item.description: A device was detonated after police approached a "suspicious" individual in Moscow, authorities said.

item.title: Crews dig into Pennsylvania nursing home rubble to see if a gas leak caused deadly blast
item.description: Crews are using construction equipment to clear the rubble of a Pennsylvania nursing home after an explosion killed two people and hospitalized 20 oth...

item.title: Explosion hits packed mosque in Nigeria
item.description: Eyewitnesses say the blast happened as people were gathered for evening prayers.

item.title: Powerball’s $1.7B jackpot could make Christmas Eve unforgettable for a lucky winner
After missing deadline, DOJ says it may need a ‘few more weeks’ to finish releasing Epstein files
DOJ says "over a million more documents" found, potentially related to Epstein case
item.description: The Justice Department said the process of releasing the Epstein files may take "a few more weeks" due to the volume of materials.

item.title: California storm threatens homes and holiday travel
